capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from birth just because of your parents' deaths? It's a heavy burden to carry, but Harry rose to the challenge and became an incredible hero.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been looking into Dudley's lineage and it seems that his maculogy is quite interesting. To be honest, I'm pretty certain that this information is accurate, which makes me feel confident about what I've found out. It's not just a hunch, but rather a well-researched fact that I can stand by.

So, I've been doing some research on Dudley and it seems that his lineage is quite complex. Apparently, he had a condition called maculogy which affects the retina of the eye. It's not something that's commonly discussed, but it's definitely interesting to learn about.
